args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let X and Y be normed vector spaces over â„. Show that if A,B : X â†’ Y are linear and bounded operators, then A + B is bounded. Also show that if Î± âˆˆ â„, then Î± A is bounded. Show that âˆ¥ Â· âˆ¥_{L(X,Y)} is a norm on L(X,Y). -/

variables {X Y : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup X] [NormedAddCommGroup Y] [NormedField â„]
  [NormedSpace â„ X] [NormedSpace â„ Y]

-- Boundedness of the sum of two bounded linear maps
theorem bounded_add (A B : X â†’L[â„] Y) :
  âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ x : X, â€–(A + B) xâ€– â‰¤ C * â€–xâ€– := by
  sorry

-- Boundedness of a scalar multiple of a bounded linear map
theorem bounded_smul (Î± : â„) (A : X â†’L[â„] Y) :
  âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ x : X, â€–(Î± â€¢ A) xâ€– â‰¤ C * â€–xâ€– := by
  sorry

-- The operator norm satisfies the norm axioms on the space of continuous linear maps
theorem operator_norm_zero_iff (f : X â†’L[â„] Y) :
  â€–fâ€– = 0 â†” f = 0 := by
  sorry

theorem operator_norm_triangle (f g : X â†’L[â„] Y) :
  â€–f + gâ€– â‰¤ â€–fâ€– + â€–gâ€– := by
  sorry

theorem operator_norm_smul (a : â„) (f : X â†’L[â„] Y) :
  â€–a â€¢ fâ€– = |a| * â€–fâ€– := by
  sorry

variables {X Y : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup X] [NormedAddCommGroup Y]
  [NormedField â„]
  [NormedSpace â„ X] [NormedSpace â„ Y]

-- Boundedness of the sum of two bounded linear maps

  âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ x : X, â€–(A + B) xâ€– â‰¤ C * â€–xâ€– := by
  sorry

-- Boundedness of a scalar multiple of a bounded linear map
theorem bounded_smul (Î± : â„) (A : X â†’L[â„] Y) :
  âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ x : X, â€–(Î± â€¢ A) xâ€– â‰¤ C * â€–xâ€– := by

-- The operator norm satisfies the norm axioms on the space of continuous linear maps

import Mathlib

/-- Let X and Y be normed vector spaces over a normed field ğ•œ (in particular â„).
If A,B : X â†’L[ğ•œ] Y are continuous linear maps, then A + B is bounded;
if Î± âˆˆ ğ•œ, then Î± â€¢ A is bounded; and the operator norm is a norm on X â†’L[ğ•œ] Y. -/

variable {ğ•œ : Type*} [NormedField ğ•œ]
variable {E F : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedAddCommGroup F]
variable [NormedSpace ğ•œ E] [NormedSpace ğ•œ F]

-- Boundedness of the sum of two bounded linear maps
theorem bounded_add (A B : E â†’L[ğ•œ] F) :
  âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ x : E, â€–(A + B) xâ€– â‰¤ C * â€–xâ€– := by
  sorry

-- Boundedness of a scalar multiple of a bounded linear map
theorem bounded_smul (Î± : ğ•œ) (A : E â†’L[ğ•œ] F) :
  âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ x : E, â€–(Î± â€¢ A) xâ€– â‰¤ C * â€–xâ€– := by
  sorry

-- The operator norm satisfies the norm axioms on the space of continuous linear maps
theorem operator_norm_zero_iff (f : E â†’L[ğ•œ] F) :
  â€–fâ€– = 0 â†” f = 0 := by
  sorry

theorem operator_norm_triangle (f g : E â†’L[ğ•œ] F) :
  â€–f + gâ€– â‰¤ â€–fâ€– + â€–gâ€– := by
  sorry

theorem operator_norm_smul (a : ğ•œ) (f : E â†’L[ğ•œ] F) :
  â€–a â€¢ fâ€– = â€–aâ€– * â€–fâ€– := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {k : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField k]
variable {E : Type*} {F : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedAddCommGroup F]
variable [NormedSpace k E] [NormedSpace k F]

/-- If A and B are continuous linear maps E â†’L[k] F, then A + B is bounded (continuous). -/
theorem bounded_add (A B : E â†’L[k] F) :
  âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ x : E, â€–(A + B) xâ€– â‰¤ C * â€–xâ€– := by
  sorry

/-- If Î± is a scalar, then Î± â€¢ A is bounded. -/
theorem bounded_smul (Î± : k) (A : E â†’L[k] F) :
  âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ x : E, â€–(Î± â€¢ A) xâ€– â‰¤ C * â€–xâ€– := by
  sorry

/-- The operator norm vanishes only for the zero map. -/
theorem operator_norm_zero_iff (f : E â†’L[k] F) :
  â€–fâ€– = 0 â†” f = 0 := by
  sorry

/-- Triangle inequality for the operator norm. -/
theorem operator_norm_triangle (f g : E â†’L[k] F) :
  â€–f + gâ€– â‰¤ â€–fâ€– + â€–gâ€– := by
  sorry

/-- Homogeneity of the operator norm: â€–a â€¢ fâ€– = â€–aâ€– * â€–fâ€–. -/
theorem operator_norm_smul (a : k) (f : E â†’L[k] F) :
  â€–a â€¢ fâ€– = â€–aâ€– * â€–fâ€– := by
  sorry
